text: Paul Caswell Powe Farnes, (16 July 1918 - 28 January 2020) was a Royal Air Force fighter pilot. He was born in Hampshire, England. He was a Second World War flying ace who flew during the Battle of Britain as one of "The Few", during which he scored 8 kills (comprising 7 and 2 shared destroyed, 2 'probables' and 11 damaged).'Aces High' Shores & Williams, 1994, page 257 Farnes died on 28 January 2020 in Hampshire at the age of 101.Paul Farnes, last Battle of Britain ace, dies aged 101 ==References== ==Other websites== *RCAF 70 Anniversary article Category:1918 births Category:2020 deaths Category:British military personnel of World War II Category:English centenarians Category:People from Hampshire
title: Paul Farnes
